settings.title:
From the Earth,
For the Earth
The True Weight Of Our Reliance On Plastic

settings.text: Plastic waste accounts for more than 300 million tons per year, which is more than the combined weight of the entire human population. 80% of the waste generated is made up of single-use items, and only 9% of all plastic is recycled; the rest ends up in landfills, dumps, or natural environments, like the ocean. Using natural oil to make plastics and other single-use materials also releases carbon dioxide and greenhouse gasses into the atmosphere, having detrimental effects on the environment.
International Union for Conservation of Nature 2021. Statistics: “Marine Plastic Pollution” ICUN 2021

settings.title: Making The Best Case For Your Phone & The Planet

settings.text: It was essential that we design a material that would endure the most rigorous wear and tear while also composting at the end of its lifespan. The result is something that we feel is truly next-level in sustainable protection.

settings.title: InnoMaize™ - It May Be Corny, But It’s Not Plastic!
settings.text: We strive to make the future of plastic plant-based. Our Laguna and Sequoia collection cases are constructed with InnoMaize™, a compostable bioplastic derived from cornstarch, sugar, and plant-based materials. By having a low carbon footprint and releasing little to no greenhouse gases, InnoMaize™ is an a-maize-ing alternative to conventional plastic, which is made from oil and releases harmful toxins and gases that pollute our planet.

settings.title: CornBo™ - Give Plastic The Boot with Bamboo
settings.text: We knew we had to get tough if we wanted to eliminate plastic! Our Mojave collection cases are reinforced with CornBo™, a composite of corn scratch, corn sugar, bamboo bark, and bamboo fiber that's not only compostable but also tough as stone! With its exceptional strength-to-weight ratio, CornBo™ is extremely lightweight while exhibiting exceptional durability, making it an excellent shock absorber and impact protector. Although bamboo is a natural resource, its ability to grow fast helps prevent deforestation and reduce carbon emissions. Bamboo is a hidden strength we believe is key to saving our planet!

settings.title: Designed to Phase Out Waste
settings.text:
Our materials are made through a fermentation process that involves extracting starch from plants such as corn, sugar cane, and cassava and then mixing it with acidic or bacterial enzymes.

During this process, the starch is converted into glucose, or sugar, and produces lactic acid to create the basic components of InnoMaize™ and CornBo™.

The material is then spun and mixed with activated carbon before getting dehydrated in a vacuum oven to be used as fiber.

Often, fibers like these play an important role in plant structural performance and when incorporated into InnoMaize™ and CornBo™, add significant strength.

With a high strength-to-weight ratio, InnoMaize™ and CornBo™ have high fracture toughness, durability, and reusability, giving them an edge over other materials.
